nodes.name: üìä Fetch Ready Profiles from Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## üéØ LinkedIn Profile & Post Scraper Workflow
**Purpose:** Automatically extract comprehensive LinkedIn profile information and recent posts using Apify actors

### üìã Workflow Steps:
1. **Profile Processing** ‚Üí Fetch profiles marked as "ready" from Google Sheets
2. **Batch Control** ‚Üí Limit processing to prevent rate limits  
3. **Profile Scraping** ‚Üí Extract detailed profile data using Apify
4. **Status Monitoring** ‚Üí Wait and check until scraping completes
5. **Data Storage** ‚Üí Save profile information back to Google Sheets
6. **Post Scraping** ‚Üí Extract recent posts from scraped profiles
7. **Final Storage** ‚Üí Save post data to separate sheet tab

### üîÑ Automated Flow:
Manual Trigger ‚Üí Profile Scraping ‚Üí Data Update ‚Üí Post Scraping ‚Üí Final Storage

## üë§ Profile Information Extraction
**Actor Used:** [LinkedIn Profile Scraper](https://console.apify.com/actors/2SyF0bVxmgGr8IVCZ/runs) (Apify)

### üìä Data Extracted:
- Basic Info: Name, headline, location, connections
- Professional: Current job, company details, experience
- Contact: Email, mobile (when available)
- Social: Profile picture, LinkedIn URL, about section
- Detailed: Skills, education, certifications, recommendations

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Requirements:
- Valid Apify API key
- LinkedIn profile URLs in "ready" status
- Proper rate limiting to avoid blocks

assignments.name: profile_ids

parameters.content:
## Google API Instructions

1. Go to [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/)
   - Create a new project  
   - Enable **Custom Search API**  
   - Go to **Credentials** and copy your **API Key**

2. Go to [Programmable Search Engine](https://programmablesearchengine.google.com/controlpanel/create)
   - Create a name  
   - Select **Search entire web**  
   - Copy the **cx** value

## Usage Limits (Free Tier)

- The free tier of the Google Custom Search API allows **100 requests per day**
- Each request returns **up to 10 search results**
- This means you can get **up to 1,000 search results per day** at no cost

json.headline: President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America
json.jobTitle: President Unilever USA, CEO Personal Care North America
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Marketing Strategy, Customer Insight, Cross-functional Team Leadership, Brand Management, Sales Management
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

updates.postText:
What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.topSkillsByEndorsements: SEC filings, US GAAP, Internal Controls, Financial Reporting, Sarbanes-Oxley Act
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

description.text: Led more than 35,000 partners and professionals across the United States. Also served as Chair of the Americas region.

It was a celebration of our firm's legacy of helping to solve our clients‚Äô and communities‚Äô most complex challenges and the lasting impact our people will continue to make as we deliver on our firm promise. Here are some of my reflections on this exciting moment in our firm's history. #Beyond125

This year‚Äôs CEO Outlook reveals that U.S. CEOs clearly aren‚Äôt aiming to just grow their businesses. They also want to build a better society. This edition of my newsletter dives into KPMG IMPACT‚Äôs $1.5B commitment to ESG and its connection to how business leaders are driving action on ESG. #CEOoutlook #ESG #governance #compliance

It was a pleasure to join Brian Sozzi and Myles Udland on Yahoo Finance today. U.S. CEOs are aggressively investing in the future of their organizations through M&A and digital, as revealed by our latest U.S. #CEOoutlook. Read/watch more here: https://lnkd.in/eXYJ2szX

As the CEO of USA Flag, I lead the vision and strategy for promoting and developing the sport of flag football worldwide. With over 17 years of experience in the sports community, I am passionate about creating opportunities and experiences for players, coaches, and fans of this fast-growing and exciting sport.

I am also the founder and president of iTitans Digital, creative services organizations that serve as a full-scale branding, website design, app development and creative resource for our clients. I manage a team of talented professionals who deliver high-quality design, marketing, and SEO solutions for various industries and sectors. I leverage my expertise in the Adobe Suite, brand strategy, and client management to ensure every project is executed with excellence and heart.

At iTitans, we‚Äôve built a reputation for blazing new trails ‚Äî creating innovative digital solutions that open doors, elevate brands, and set new standards. My role is to help other businesses succeed by applying the same proven strategies and forward-thinking approaches that have fueled our own growth.

iTitans is a full-service digital agency specializing in website design, app development, creative solutions, and marketing strategy. I work closely with organizations to identify opportunities, align our services with their vision, and deliver scalable solutions that drive measurable impact.

Whether you‚Äôre a sports property looking to expand your reach, or a business ready to take the next step in your digital journey, I‚Äôd love to connect and explore how iTitans can help you achieve your goals.

json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.

json.headline: CEO, USA Curling
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Advertising, Social Media, New Media, Content Strategy, Social Media Marketing
json.addressWithCountry: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
json.about:
An expert communicator and proven leader of people with extensive experience in marketing, sport, promotion, and advertising. Exceeded client expectations as a creative at ad agencies in New York City and Michigan, and led staff as a creative director and partner at a 40-person firm. 

Elected by my athlete peers to serve as the USA Curling representative to the USOPC Athletes Advisory Council from 2017-2021, I joined USA Curling as Director of Development before being selected as Interim CEO in November of 2022. 

I was a member of the team that captured the 2012 USA Curling Men's National Championship, but it is my experience off the ice that serves me well as I lead the National Governing Body for the sport in the United States. With a career that has included both managing the collective efforts of many and solo entrepreneurial pursuits, I am focused on producing tangible results and generating revenue. 

I am passionate about the sport of curling at every level‚Äîelite to recreational‚Äîand I have served the sport in multiple capacities. In addition to my work at USA Curling, I have been the President of my home club in South Plainfield, New Jersey, led outreach efforts through CurlNYC, and led skills clinics around the country. 

My creative instincts help me find fresh solutions to problems, and I bring an everything-can-be-improved attitude to my work.

description.text: Worked to grow the sport across the country by expanding our facility footprint, helping our member clubs thrive, and strengthening the connection between curlers and the governing body for the sport in the United States. Developed Junior Curling Program and Learn-to-Curl guides. Served as lead analyst on USA Curling webcasts of national championships and Olympic Trials. Revamped instructor education and increased availability of courses. Created new revenue streams for the national organization.

I was a marketing and creative consultant for a range of consumer and B-to-B brands, with a heavy focus on SaaS providers. Clients included eZCom Software, Broker Buddha, Inveniam, Bell's Brewery, and Manitou Boats, and services provided included marketing strategy, copywriting, online and offline advertising, video production, and collateral creation.

Founded and established new media communications firm. Sold the agency to two employees after moving to East Coast. Wrote extensively about the seismic changes in the agency and media worlds. Continue to work for the company in a consulting role.

Managed a staff of 12-16 copywriters, art directors, print producers and broadcast producers. Directed the development of advertising campaigns and brand work for a range of clients, including Borgess Health Alliance, Bell‚Äôs Brewery, DePuy (a Johnson & Johnson company), Oakwood Hospital, HoMedics, Binder Park Zoo, M-Care and Whirlpool. During my tenure, the agency was recognized nationally for its work, winning awards in national competitions such as The One Show and the Creative Arts Advertising Annual. I also led new business pitches while I was with the agency, producing winning results in 80% of the reviews we were invited to participate in.

Created advertising campaigns for Star Alliance, United Airlines, Miller and Dr. Pepper. I was the lead copywriter on Star Alliance and supervised the work on that account and the United Airlines international business. Managed a small group of writers and art directors.

fixedListComponent.text: I have been working with Daniel as his Technical Manager since 2017, and put simply, its been an amazing experience. When I first spoke with Daniel, my expectations were minimal: to learns a bit about the QA startup industry. However, Daniel went above and beyond‚Äì the first thing he told me when I was accepted was that I was going to be a leader, even though I did not think so myself. And that is really the greatest thing about Daniel‚Äì he builds leaders. His innermost belief is that anyone can be a leader given the right tools. On top of that, I have, side-by-side seen him build our team from a couple of members to a bustling team of 20 and beyond. When anyone speaks, Daniel listens closely and with swift accuracy, identifies the issues and comes up with creative solutions to any problems presented. I have practiced architecture with public and private clients for over 35 years. In this time, I've accumulated some unique insight that enables me to practice with a reverence toward people and the way they use space. Architecture is a service toward the public and this perspective is what I have instilled at my firm. Our designs have a tremendous impact on the community at large. It is crucial that we remain focused on the greater purpose, that we always remain true and authentic with one another, and as architects, we balance a complex process that our clients rely on us to know, and know well. 

My passion for architecture grows with the experiences and challenges I share with people. It is incredible how we have the ability to create meaningful places in which individuals work, live, and learn. Each project is unique and functions within a specific context of time, place and space, but it should always deliver lasting value to society.

json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.

json.headline: CEO, USA Curling
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Advertising, Social Media, New Media, Content Strategy, Social Media Marketing
json.addressWithCountry: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
json.about:
An expert communicator and proven leader of people with extensive experience in marketing, sport, promotion, and advertising. Exceeded client expectations as a creative at ad agencies in New York City and Michigan, and led staff as a creative director and partner at a 40-person firm. 

Elected by my athlete peers to serve as the USA Curling representative to the USOPC Athletes Advisory Council from 2017-2021, I joined USA Curling as Director of Development before being selected as Interim CEO in November of 2022. 

I was a member of the team that captured the 2012 USA Curling Men's National Championship, but it is my experience off the ice that serves me well as I lead the National Governing Body for the sport in the United States. With a career that has included both managing the collective efforts of many and solo entrepreneurial pursuits, I am focused on producing tangible results and generating revenue. 

I am passionate about the sport of curling at every level‚Äîelite to recreational‚Äîand I have served the sport in multiple capacities. In addition to my work at USA Curling, I have been the President of my home club in South Plainfield, New Jersey, led outreach efforts through CurlNYC, and led skills clinics around the country. 

My creative instincts help me find fresh solutions to problems, and I bring an everything-can-be-improved attitude to my work.

description.text: Worked to grow the sport across the country by expanding our facility footprint, helping our member clubs thrive, and strengthening the connection between curlers and the governing body for the sport in the United States. Developed Junior Curling Program and Learn-to-Curl guides. Served as lead analyst on USA Curling webcasts of national championships and Olympic Trials. Revamped instructor education and increased availability of courses. Created new revenue streams for the national organization.

I was a marketing and creative consultant for a range of consumer and B-to-B brands, with a heavy focus on SaaS providers. Clients included eZCom Software, Broker Buddha, Inveniam, Bell's Brewery, and Manitou Boats, and services provided included marketing strategy, copywriting, online and offline advertising, video production, and collateral creation.

Founded and established new media communications firm. Sold the agency to two employees after moving to East Coast. Wrote extensively about the seismic changes in the agency and media worlds. Continue to work for the company in a consulting role.

Managed a staff of 12-16 copywriters, art directors, print producers and broadcast producers. Directed the development of advertising campaigns and brand work for a range of clients, including Borgess Health Alliance, Bell‚Äôs Brewery, DePuy (a Johnson & Johnson company), Oakwood Hospital, HoMedics, Binder Park Zoo, M-Care and Whirlpool. During my tenure, the agency was recognized nationally for its work, winning awards in national competitions such as The One Show and the Creative Arts Advertising Annual. I also led new business pitches while I was with the agency, producing winning results in 80% of the reviews we were invited to participate in.

Created advertising campaigns for Star Alliance, United Airlines, Miller and Dr. Pepper. I was the lead copywriter on Star Alliance and supervised the work on that account and the United Airlines international business. Managed a small group of writers and art directors.

json.about:
I have practiced architecture with public and private clients for over 35 years. In this time, I've accumulated some unique insight that enables me to practice with a reverence toward people and the way they use space. Architecture is a service toward the public and this perspective is what I have instilled at my firm. Our designs have a tremendous impact on the community at large. It is crucial that we remain focused on the greater purpose, that we always remain true and authentic with one another, and as architects, we balance a complex process that our clients rely on us to know, and know well. 

My passion for architecture grows with the experiences and challenges I share with people. It is incredible how we have the ability to create meaningful places in which individuals work, live, and learn. Each project is unique and functions within a specific context of time, place and space, but it should always deliver lasting value to society.

json.headline: President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America
json.jobTitle: President Unilever USA, CEO Personal Care North America
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Marketing Strategy, Customer Insight, Cross-functional Team Leadership, Brand Management, Sales Management
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

As the CEO of USA Flag, I lead the vision and strategy for promoting and developing the sport of flag football worldwide. With over 17 years of experience in the sports community, I am passionate about creating opportunities and experiences for players, coaches, and fans of this fast-growing and exciting sport.

I am also the founder and president of iTitans Digital, creative services organizations that serve as a full-scale branding, website design, app development and creative resource for our clients. I manage a team of talented professionals who deliver high-quality design, marketing, and SEO solutions for various industries and sectors. I leverage my expertise in the Adobe Suite, brand strategy, and client management to ensure every project is executed with excellence and heart.

description.text:
As a Partner at iTitans, I lead growth initiatives with a focus on building partnerships and expanding opportunities across industries, with a particular emphasis on sports-related properties. At iTitans, we‚Äôve built a reputation for blazing new trails ‚Äî creating innovative digital solutions that open doors, elevate brands, and set new standards. My role is to help other businesses succeed by applying the same proven strategies and forward-thinking approaches that have fueled our own growth.

iTitans is a full-service digital agency specializing in website design, app development, creative solutions, and marketing strategy. I work closely with organizations to identify opportunities, align our services with their vision, and deliver scalable solutions that drive measurable impact.

Whether you‚Äôre a sports property looking to expand your reach, or a business ready to take the next step in your digital journey, I‚Äôd love to connect and explore how iTitans can help you achieve your goals.
Responsible for vision casting and strategic growth strategy for promoting and developing the sport of flag football worldwide.

I work as the Chief Operations Officer to handle all event operations, website, creative, vision, strategy and more. We currently host the single largest flag football tournament event in history.

json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.

json.headline: CEO, USA Curling
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Advertising, Social Media, New Media, Content Strategy, Social Media Marketing
json.addressWithCountry: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
json.about:
An expert communicator and proven leader of people with extensive experience in marketing, sport, promotion, and advertising. Exceeded client expectations as a creative at ad agencies in New York City and Michigan, and led staff as a creative director and partner at a 40-person firm. 

Elected by my athlete peers to serve as the USA Curling representative to the USOPC Athletes Advisory Council from 2017-2021, I joined USA Curling as Director of Development before being selected as Interim CEO in November of 2022. 

I was a member of the team that captured the 2012 USA Curling Men's National Championship, but it is my experience off the ice that serves me well as I lead the National Governing Body for the sport in the United States. With a career that has included both managing the collective efforts of many and solo entrepreneurial pursuits, I am focused on producing tangible results and generating revenue. 

I am passionate about the sport of curling at every level‚Äîelite to recreational‚Äîand I have served the sport in multiple capacities. In addition to my work at USA Curling, I have been the President of my home club in South Plainfield, New Jersey, led outreach efforts through CurlNYC, and led skills clinics around the country. 

My creative instincts help me find fresh solutions to problems, and I bring an everything-can-be-improved attitude to my work.

description.text: Worked to grow the sport across the country by expanding our facility footprint, helping our member clubs thrive, and strengthening the connection between curlers and the governing body for the sport in the United States. Developed Junior Curling Program and Learn-to-Curl guides. Served as lead analyst on USA Curling webcasts of national championships and Olympic Trials. Revamped instructor education and increased availability of courses. Created new revenue streams for the national organization.

I was a marketing and creative consultant for a range of consumer and B-to-B brands, with a heavy focus on SaaS providers. Clients included eZCom Software, Broker Buddha, Inveniam, Bell's Brewery, and Manitou Boats, and services provided included marketing strategy, copywriting, online and offline advertising, video production, and collateral creation.

Founded and established new media communications firm. Sold the agency to two employees after moving to East Coast. Wrote extensively about the seismic changes in the agency and media worlds. Continue to work for the company in a consulting role.

Managed a staff of 12-16 copywriters, art directors, print producers and broadcast producers. Directed the development of advertising campaigns and brand work for a range of clients, including Borgess Health Alliance, Bell‚Äôs Brewery, DePuy (a Johnson & Johnson company), Oakwood Hospital, HoMedics, Binder Park Zoo, M-Care and Whirlpool. During my tenure, the agency was recognized nationally for its work, winning awards in national competitions such as The One Show and the Creative Arts Advertising Annual. I also led new business pitches while I was with the agency, producing winning results in 80% of the reviews we were invited to participate in.

Created advertising campaigns for Star Alliance, United Airlines, Miller and Dr. Pepper. I was the lead copywriter on Star Alliance and supervised the work on that account and the United Airlines international business. Managed a small group of writers and art directors.

json.about:
I have practiced architecture with public and private clients for over 35 years. In this time, I've accumulated some unique insight that enables me to practice with a reverence toward people and the way they use space. Architecture is a service toward the public and this perspective is what I have instilled at my firm. Our designs have a tremendous impact on the community at large. It is crucial that we remain focused on the greater purpose, that we always remain true and authentic with one another, and as architects, we balance a complex process that our clients rely on us to know, and know well. 

My passion for architecture grows with the experiences and challenges I share with people. It is incredible how we have the ability to create meaningful places in which individuals work, live, and learn. Each project is unique and functions within a specific context of time, place and space, but it should always deliver lasting value to society.

json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

updates.postText:
What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.topSkillsByEndorsements: SEC filings, US GAAP, Internal Controls, Financial Reporting, Sarbanes-Oxley Act
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.

json.headline: CEO, USA Curling
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Advertising, Social Media, New Media, Content Strategy, Social Media Marketing
json.addressWithCountry: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
json.about:
An expert communicator and proven leader of people with extensive experience in marketing, sport, promotion, and advertising. Exceeded client expectations as a creative at ad agencies in New York City and Michigan, and led staff as a creative director and partner at a 40-person firm. 

Elected by my athlete peers to serve as the USA Curling representative to the USOPC Athletes Advisory Council from 2017-2021, I joined USA Curling as Director of Development before being selected as Interim CEO in November of 2022. 

I was a member of the team that captured the 2012 USA Curling Men's National Championship, but it is my experience off the ice that serves me well as I lead the National Governing Body for the sport in the United States. With a career that has included both managing the collective efforts of many and solo entrepreneurial pursuits, I am focused on producing tangible results and generating revenue. 

I am passionate about the sport of curling at every level‚Äîelite to recreational‚Äîand I have served the sport in multiple capacities. In addition to my work at USA Curling, I have been the President of my home club in South Plainfield, New Jersey, led outreach efforts through CurlNYC, and led skills clinics around the country. 

My creative instincts help me find fresh solutions to problems, and I bring an everything-can-be-improved attitude to my work.

description.text: Worked to grow the sport across the country by expanding our facility footprint, helping our member clubs thrive, and strengthening the connection between curlers and the governing body for the sport in the United States. Developed Junior Curling Program and Learn-to-Curl guides. Served as lead analyst on USA Curling webcasts of national championships and Olympic Trials. Revamped instructor education and increased availability of courses. Created new revenue streams for the national organization.

I was a marketing and creative consultant for a range of consumer and B-to-B brands, with a heavy focus on SaaS providers. Clients included eZCom Software, Broker Buddha, Inveniam, Bell's Brewery, and Manitou Boats, and services provided included marketing strategy, copywriting, online and offline advertising, video production, and collateral creation.

Founded and established new media communications firm. Sold the agency to two employees after moving to East Coast. Wrote extensively about the seismic changes in the agency and media worlds. Continue to work for the company in a consulting role.

Managed a staff of 12-16 copywriters, art directors, print producers and broadcast producers. Directed the development of advertising campaigns and brand work for a range of clients, including Borgess Health Alliance, Bell‚Äôs Brewery, DePuy (a Johnson & Johnson company), Oakwood Hospital, HoMedics, Binder Park Zoo, M-Care and Whirlpool. During my tenure, the agency was recognized nationally for its work, winning awards in national competitions such as The One Show and the Creative Arts Advertising Annual. I also led new business pitches while I was with the agency, producing winning results in 80% of the reviews we were invited to participate in.

Created advertising campaigns for Star Alliance, United Airlines, Miller and Dr. Pepper. I was the lead copywriter on Star Alliance and supervised the work on that account and the United Airlines international business. Managed a small group of writers and art directors.

I have practiced architecture with public and private clients for over 35 years. In this time, I've accumulated some unique insight that enables me to practice with a reverence toward people and the way they use space. Architecture is a service toward the public and this perspective is what I have instilled at my firm. Our designs have a tremendous impact on the community at large. It is crucial that we remain focused on the greater purpose, that we always remain true and authentic with one another, and as architects, we balance a complex process that our clients rely on us to know, and know well. 

My passion for architecture grows with the experiences and challenges I share with people. It is incredible how we have the ability to create meaningful places in which individuals work, live, and learn. Each project is unique and functions within a specific context of time, place and space, but it should always deliver lasting value to society.

json.about:
I‚Äôm proud to lead #TeamSiemens and chair the Siemens Foundation in our largest market in the world where Siemens has been advancing industry and infrastructure for more than 160 years. 

I also serve on the board of directors of the Center for Strategic and Budgetary Assessments (CSBA), Triumph Group, National Association of Manufacturers (NAM), Chief Executives for Corporate Purpose (CECP), Consumer Technology Association Board of Industry Leaders, Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, and Economic Club of Washington, D.C.

What has guided me throughout my career is exploring the true purpose of technology: expanding what‚Äôs humanly possible. I‚Äôm also passionate about workforce development, mentoring, and what I call a work-life blend that honors my priorities both at Siemens and as a grandmother. 

Subscribe to my podcast, #OptimisticOutlook, where I‚Äôm joined by experts exploring the technological transformation occurring across American industry and infrastructure.

description.text: Leads strategy, operations and services in the United States in the areas of electrification, automation and digitalization for Siemens USA, the largest subsidiary of Siemens AG, one of the world‚Äôs largest producers of energy-efficient, resource-saving technologies.

(SGT), a leading integrator of Siemens‚Äô innovative products, technologies and services for programs and requirements at federal government agencies and departments in the areas of energy generation, transmission, distribution and efficiency, infrastructure modernization, industrial applications and integrated electric power solutions for the air, land and sea domains. In this role, served as an Officer and Director of the Board of Directors of SGT.

Ensured that SGT had the most effective and efficient processes, from identifying business opportunities to winning new work and ensuring Siemens delivery to its federal customers is of the highest quality and the best value. Led business development, enabling Siemens to help federal customers perform their missions to address national imperatives in infrastructure, energy and healthcare.

json.headline: President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America
json.jobTitle: President Unilever USA, CEO Personal Care North America
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Marketing Strategy, Customer Insight, Cross-functional Team Leadership, Brand Management, Sales Management
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

updates.postText:
What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.

json.headline: CEO, USA Curling
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Advertising, Social Media, New Media, Content Strategy, Social Media Marketing
json.addressWithCountry: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
json.about:
An expert communicator and proven leader of people with extensive experience in marketing, sport, promotion, and advertising. Exceeded client expectations as a creative at ad agencies in New York City and Michigan, and led staff as a creative director and partner at a 40-person firm. 

Elected by my athlete peers to serve as the USA Curling representative to the USOPC Athletes Advisory Council from 2017-2021, I joined USA Curling as Director of Development before being selected as Interim CEO in November of 2022. 

I was a member of the team that captured the 2012 USA Curling Men's National Championship, but it is my experience off the ice that serves me well as I lead the National Governing Body for the sport in the United States. With a career that has included both managing the collective efforts of many and solo entrepreneurial pursuits, I am focused on producing tangible results and generating revenue. 

I am passionate about the sport of curling at every level‚Äîelite to recreational‚Äîand I have served the sport in multiple capacities. In addition to my work at USA Curling, I have been the President of my home club in South Plainfield, New Jersey, led outreach efforts through CurlNYC, and led skills clinics around the country. 

My creative instincts help me find fresh solutions to problems, and I bring an everything-can-be-improved attitude to my work.

description.text: Worked to grow the sport across the country by expanding our facility footprint, helping our member clubs thrive, and strengthening the connection between curlers and the governing body for the sport in the United States. Developed Junior Curling Program and Learn-to-Curl guides. Served as lead analyst on USA Curling webcasts of national championships and Olympic Trials. Revamped instructor education and increased availability of courses. Created new revenue streams for the national organization.

I was a marketing and creative consultant for a range of consumer and B-to-B brands, with a heavy focus on SaaS providers. Clients included eZCom Software, Broker Buddha, Inveniam, Bell's Brewery, and Manitou Boats, and services provided included marketing strategy, copywriting, online and offline advertising, video production, and collateral creation.

Founded and established new media communications firm. Sold the agency to two employees after moving to East Coast. Wrote extensively about the seismic changes in the agency and media worlds. Continue to work for the company in a consulting role.

Managed a staff of 12-16 copywriters, art directors, print producers and broadcast producers. Directed the development of advertising campaigns and brand work for a range of clients, including Borgess Health Alliance, Bell‚Äôs Brewery, DePuy (a Johnson & Johnson company), Oakwood Hospital, HoMedics, Binder Park Zoo, M-Care and Whirlpool. During my tenure, the agency was recognized nationally for its work, winning awards in national competitions such as The One Show and the Creative Arts Advertising Annual. I also led new business pitches while I was with the agency, producing winning results in 80% of the reviews we were invited to participate in.

Created advertising campaigns for Star Alliance, United Airlines, Miller and Dr. Pepper. I was the lead copywriter on Star Alliance and supervised the work on that account and the United Airlines international business. Managed a small group of writers and art directors.

json.headline: Senior Partner | CEO at USA Architects, Planners + Interior Designers, Ltd.
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Construction, Architecture, Leadership, LEED AP, Architectural Design
json.about:
I have practiced architecture with public and private clients for over 35 years. In this time, I've accumulated some unique insight that enables me to practice with a reverence toward people and the way they use space. Architecture is a service toward the public and this perspective is what I have instilled at my firm. Our designs have a tremendous impact on the community at large. It is crucial that we remain focused on the greater purpose, that we always remain true and authentic with one another, and as architects, we balance a complex process that our clients rely on us to know, and know well. 

My passion for architecture grows with the experiences and challenges I share with people. It is incredible how we have the ability to create meaningful places in which individuals work, live, and learn. Each project is unique and functions within a specific context of time, place and space, but it should always deliver lasting value to society.

json.headline: President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America
json.jobTitle: President Unilever USA, CEO Personal Care North America
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Marketing Strategy, Customer Insight, Cross-functional Team Leadership, Brand Management, Sales Management
json.addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
json.about:
Herrish Patel was appointed President Unilever USA and CEO Personal Care North America in January 2024.  In his role as President of Unilever USA, Herrish is the senior executive representing Unilever‚Äôs business in the U.S., focusing on building Unilever‚Äôs corporate reputation, culture, and talent network, as well as leading its customer business development and governance agendas. As CEO Personal Care North America and a member of the Personal Care Business Group Leadership Team, Herrish is responsible for Unilever‚Äôs deodorant and skin cleansing business in the U.S. and Canada. In this role, Herrish oversees Unilever‚Äôs category-leading, innovation-powered Personal Care brands including Dove, Degree, and Axe among other brands. 

Herrish joined the company in 2001, and has moved across the globe ‚Äì including Australia, Eastern Europe, and Asia ‚Äì managing sales, marketing, category management, and strategic development. Herrish moved to the U.S. in 2021 and served as Executive Vice President of Nutrition North America, where he oversaw Unilever‚Äôs beloved Nutrition brands including Hellmann‚Äôs and Knorr, as well as Sir Kensington‚Äôs and Maille.  His earlier appointments with Unilever included leading the East Europe leadership team responsible for consumers across 20 countries in Eastern Europe, managing director for Czech & Slovak Republic, and customer development positions in Australia & New Zealand and in Singapore.

Prior to joining Unilever, Herrish spent six years in the CPG industry in sales and customer development positions in the UK, including with Nestl√© and Iceland Frozen Foods.   

Herrish is a graduate from the University of Cardiff, UK, BSc. (Hons.) Economics & Management Studies. He is married with two children, and lives in New York City.

updates.postText:
What a way to end the day! The Unilever team got the chance to ring the closing bell at the NYSE as we celebrated our #Hellmanns and Dove teams going big at the Big Game in two weeks!  

Our Power Brands continue to perform, connecting with people both on and off the field. Stay tuned for what‚Äôs in store next month‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!  

Gary Wade Lourdes Casta√±eda Matt Gregory Nuria Hern√°ndez Crespo Kathryn Fernandez Melissa Grevstad Laura DiMiceli Kevin Tolson Caroline Schwieger Jessica Grigoriou Brent Lukowski Jenna Dowd Alex Leo, mba Pranav Chandan

I‚Äôve recently been reflecting on the foundational values that have shaped my journey as a leader at Unilever. I had the pleasure of discussing my approach with Adam Bryant in his Art of Leading newsletter.
¬†
As Adam and I were discussing leadership styles and lessons, there were three approaches we kept coming back to that have made a material difference in my own way of working and leading teams:
¬†
‚è∫ Waste time together
‚è∫ Listen first
‚è∫ Balance structure and strategy
¬†
A big thank you to Adam for a thought-provoking conversation, and I hope my reflections are helpful to others navigating career growth, transitions, and ever-evolving expectations as a leader.

Two of Unilever‚Äôs power brands are gearing up for a return to the Big Game in 2025! I can‚Äôt wait to see Dove and #Hellmanns back on one of marketing‚Äôs biggest stages. We love the opportunity to connect with football fans across the country on the day of the Big Game, as well as in the lead up, as the excitement builds online and in stores.¬†
¬†¬†
While I can‚Äôt reveal too much just yet, I‚Äôll say this: get ready for two unforgettable spots. Stay tuned!¬†

json.about:
I was honored to be Chair and CEO of KPMG in the United States from 2020-2025. I owe a debt of gratitude to the many people and teams I have worked with at KPMG. We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients.

After graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, my career at KPMG started nearly 40 years ago in the San Antonio, Texas office. Since then I served in our offices in New York, Norfolk, Stamford, Chicago, and St. Louis. I enjoyed every experience and stop on my journey and was incredibly fortunate to work with so many KPMG colleagues across the world. My experience working with a number of large clients and diverse teams and my past service on our KPMG board of directors gave me a great appreciation of our business and the needs of our clients.  

I drove growth at KPMG by building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.

As the CEO of USA Flag, I lead the vision and strategy for promoting and developing the sport of flag football worldwide. With over 17 years of experience in the sports community, I am passionate about creating opportunities and experiences for players, coaches, and fans of this fast-growing and exciting sport.

I am also the founder and president of iTitans Digital, creative services organizations that serve as a full-scale branding, website design, app development and creative resource for our clients. I manage a team of talented professionals who deliver high-quality design, marketing, and SEO solutions for various industries and sectors. json.headline: President and CEO at World Food Program USA
json.topSkillsByEndorsements: Fundraising, Annual Giving, Philanthropy, Nonprofits, Strategic Planning
json.addressWithCountry: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
json.about:
Barron Segar is the President and CEO of World Food Program USA, the nonprofit charged with inspiring and mobilizing people in the United States to support the mission of the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) to feed the world's hungriest people. He has more than 20 years of experience growing philanthropic and cause marketing platforms for organizations spanning global humanitarian aid, public broadcasting and finance. Under his leadership, World Food Program USA quadrupled its revenue in less than three years and earned an ‚ÄúExceptional‚Äù four-star rating from Charity Navigator for its financial health, accountability and transparency. In 2021, The NonProfit Times recognized Barron on its Power & Influence Top 50 list for leadership centered on innovation, broad sector influence and developing replicable organizational models.  

A leading voice on global food security, Barron has been featured in media outlets including MSNBC, Forbes, The Hill, The Guardian and The Chronicle of Philanthropy and at events hosted by the World Affairs Councils of America, Alliance Bernstein, Liberty Mutual, The Global Philanthropy Forum, among others. He has also led visits to field operations in Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador and the Polish border of Ukraine to shine a light on the lifesaving work of the U.N. World Food Programme.  

Prior to World Food Program USA, Barron served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Development Officer at UNICEF USA, with organization-wide responsibility for strategy, budget, and critical operational priorities. He led the strategic direction of the Development Division, raising $500 million in annual revenue. Previously, Barron served as the Director of Development for Georgia Public Broadcasting, where he and his team were nationally recognized for record breaking fundraising performance. Barron also has experience in the private sector working in financial services.‚ÄØ 

Barron is a founding and current Board Member at the Elton John AIDS Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board for Open Hand Atlanta. He earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Hampden-Sydney College.
